1:
"But now, men who are younger than I am make fun of me—\q2 men whose fathers I greatly despised—
\q2 their fathers, whom I would not even have allowed to help my dogs guard my sheep.
\q1
2:
They were men who were old and weak;\q2 what could I gain from having these men work for me, even when they thought they were strong?
\q1
3:
They were very poor and hungry,\q2 so that they chewed on roots at night
\q2 in dry and desolate places.


\q1
4:
They pulled up plants in the desert and ate them;\q2 they warmed themselves by burning the roots of broom trees.
\q1
5:
Everyone shouted at them, "Stop, thief!"\q2 and drove them from their area.
\q1
6:
They were forced to live in riverbeds,\q2 in holes in the ground, and in the sides of cliffs.


\q1
7:
In the bushes they howled like animals because they were hungry,\q2 and they huddled together under thornbushes.
\q1
9:
Now their children sing songs to make fun of me.\q2 They tell jokes about me.
\q1
10:
They are disgusted with me, and they stay away from me,\q2 but when they see me, they are happy to spit in my face.
\q1
11:
It seems as though God had cut my bowstring and caused me to be unable to defend myself; he has humbled me,\q2 and my enemies have done to me whatever they wanted.


\q1
12:
Gangs of these people attack me and force me to run away;\q2 they prepare to destroy me.
\q1
13:
They prevent me from escaping,\q2 and there is no one to keep them from attacking me.


\q1
14:
It is as though I were a city wall and they had broken through it,\q2 as though they had come crashing down on me.
\q1
15:
I am very terrified;\q2 my dignity has been blown away by the wind,
\q2 and my prosperity has disappeared as clouds disappear.



\q1
16:
Now I am about to die;\q2 I suffer every day.
\q1
17:
My bones ache during the nights,\q2 and the pain that torments me never stops.


\q1
18:
It is as though God had grabbed my clothes\q2 and choked me by the collar of my coat.
\q1
19:
He has thrown me into the mud;\q2 I am not worth anything more than dust and ashes.


\q1
20:
I cry out to you, God, but you do not answer me;\q2 I stand up and pray, but you do not pay any attention.
\q1
21:
You act very cruelly toward me;\q2 with all of your power you cause me to suffer.


\q1
22:
You allow the wind to lift me up and blow me away;\q2 and you make a violent storm blow me around.
\q1
23:
I know that you will cause me to die,\q2 which is what happens to everyone who is alive.


\q1
25:
I myself wept for people who were experiencing troubles,\q2 and I felt sorry for poor people.
\q1
26:
However, when I expected good things to happen to me, evil things happened;\q2 when I waited for light, I experienced darkness instead.


\q1
27:
I am very distressed all the time;\q2 I suffer every day.
\q1
28:
I go about very discouraged;\q2 I stand up and plead for people to help me.
\q1
29:
My wailing is as sad as jackals and ostriches in the wilderness.

\q1
30:
My skin has become dark and is peeling off,\q2 and I have a fever which causes my body to feel as though it were burning up with a fever.
\q1
31: Previously, I played joyful music on my harp and with my flute,\q2 but now I play only the sad music of those who mourn."
